Oscar Tomas Tintel Penña Neto (May 26, 1982) is a Brazilian singer-songwriter. It became nationally known after winning the Popstars talent show in 2003 and joining the boy band Br'oz.
In 2003, he won the Popstars talent show and joined the Brazilian boy band Br'oz until 2005, with which he released two studio albums, Br'oz (2003) and Segundo Ato (2004). they sold over 550,000 copies of the debut album and 40,000 copies of the first DVD. BR'OZ had two number one singles in Brazil: "Prometida" and "Vem Pra Minha Vida". In 2004, they released the album Segundo Ato.
After the group ended, he recorded some solo career songs, joined the Eternal Astral pagoda group, but soon after was called to join the Disguise Group. Since 2013, however, Oscar has pursued a solo career and focused on working behind the limelight in producing other composing artists. There are songs recorded by Br'oz, Exaltasamba, Os Travessos, Thiaguinho, Ludmilla, Katinguelê, Rodriguinho and many others. Oscar also acts as a music producer, producing the groups he was a part of and other artists such as Marcelly and Br'oz himself, along with band members and musician Tiago Santana. On December 11, 2018 recorded his first solo career DVD in the city of Pelotas RS with special appearances such as: humorist Nego Di, singer Gaab, Mr. Dan, André Marinho and Jhean Marcell who were part of the group BR'OZ.
